title: Playwright Agent /MCP tools to support npm script based execution.
description: ### ðŸš€ Feature Request It is very common practice to have custom command line arguments to set the runner env contexts. In current setup, if we have any custom command line arguments, Playwright agents and mcp is not able to handle them. If we enable npm script support for mcp tools, it will boost the capability to handle all various type of arguments and custom setup of the project. ### Example mcp tools can execute npm run <script> it will handle all configuration requirement. ### Motivation...

title: [Docs]: Document SVG imports for Component Testing
description: ### Page(s) ### Description Currently, Component Testing documentation does not contain any information about how to handle SVG imports in tested components. Without proper configuration, it results in failing tests as proper SVG loader is missing (at least in React). And to be honest, SVG imports are after CSS the most commonly used imports in components. There are two approaches available. **Without configuration** This uses data URL and it does not require further configuration. [code bloc...

description: How to automatically clear the cache files after the playwright command is executed, without having to manually clear them through a command. Expection 1. Execute the command "npx playwright", 2. Wait for the task to be completed, 3. Automatically clear the cache of this task.

title: Add testInfo.disable() to completely exclude tests from reports and execution tracking
description: Feature Request Currently, Playwright provides testInfo.skip() in beforeEach (and other hooks) to conditionally skip tests. While this is useful, skipped tests are still included in test reports â€” they appear as "skipped" in the output, CI logs, and HTML reporter. I'd like to propose a new method: testInfo.disable() â€” which would completely remove a test from execution and reporting, as if it didn't exist in the test suite at all. Use Case In some environments (e.g. CI with dynamic configura...

title: Playwright cannot capture stderr from Electron apps when module loading fails during startup
description: ### Version 1.54.2 ### Steps to reproduce When launching an Electron application via Playwright's _electron.launch(), errors that occur during synchronous module loading at startup are not captured in stderr, even though these same errors appear in stderr when running Electron directly. Reproduction: `npm install` and then follow instructions in the README to see the various scenarios ### Expected behavior Playwright should capture all stderr output from the Electron process, including early ...

title: Include Playwright Package in Docker Image to Eliminate Runtime Dependency on Internet Connection
description: ### ðŸš€ Feature Request The official Playwright Docker image is version-scoped (e.g., 1.54.0) and includes all necessary system dependencies to run Playwright tests. However, the image currently removes the Playwright Node.js package during the final build stage. As a result, users must re-install the Playwright package (e.g., automatically via npx -y playwright@1.54.0) at runtime, which requires an active internet connection. This behavior seems inconsistent with the general purpose of Docker ...

title: Behavior of `maxFailures` with last-run.json and CI Test Reruns with `--last-failed`
description: ### Version 1.49.1 ### Steps to reproduce I encountered an issue while using Playwright with the `maxFailures` configuration in our CI pipeline. Here's the scenario: 1. We have `maxFailures` set to 3. 2. When running 70 tests, if the 4th test fails 3 times, Playwright stops execution as per the `maxFailures` threshold. 3. The `last-run.json` file then only contains information about the failed tests (in this case, the 4th test). 4. When rerunning the job with the `--last-failed` flag, Playwri...

Although Playwright is browser automation tool, it would be very helpful if Playwright also supports ability to validate PDF contents. User should be able to assert text elements on PDF, presence of images/icons, CSS properties for any element. Also it would be nice if in-built mechanism to validate CSV/Excel content is also provided. ...

title: Support forcedColors emulation for Firefox, Safari, and WebKit
description: ### ðŸš€ Feature Request ### Problem Currently, Playwright's `forcedColors` emulation is only supported in Chromium-based browsers. This prevents visual regression and accessibility tests in high-contrast mode from running on Firefox, Safari, and WebKit. Moreover, macOS and iOS do not natively support a system-wide forced colors equivalent like Windows' High Contrast mode, making this a significant limitation for these platforms. ### Use Case Our tests require high-contrast mode to verify that t...

When using Edge or Chrome in headless=false, closing browser takes 30000-38000 ms. Closing Chromium takes 2000-3000 ms. In ticket #27679 @yury-s suggested, that this may be due to corporate policies imposed on browser and requested for logs. This happends in headed mode (headless=false) ### Expected behavior Closing Edge / Chrome in 2-3 seconds or not much l...

title: `getByRole` is 1.5x slower than CSS selectors
description: `getByRole` is 1.5x slower than CSS selectors. Probably, because [`getByRole` uses of `querySelectorAll('*')` and matches elements by the accessible name]( [code block] I [debugged `getByRole` internals]( but haven't profiled yet. I can profile and optimize the code if it's important for the community to improve the "smart" locators performance.

title: Playwright Java cannot connect to CDP without Node/driver-bundle
description: ### Version 1.55.0 ### Steps to reproduce **Description :** When using Playwright Java in remote/CDP-only scenarios, it is not possible to avoid the Node-based driver or the driver-bundle. Even when providing a custom driver via `playwright.driver.impl`, `Playwright.create()` still attempts to spawn the Node driver, resulting in failures if the driver-bundle is not present. The driver-bundle is around 200 MB, which is a heavy dependency for users who only need to connect to a remote browser o...
